event.doc_name: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: On October 3, 2023, President Biden nominated Plaintiff Hampton Dellinger to be Special Counsel of the Office of Special Counsel. The Senate confirmed Mr. Dellinger on February 27, 2024, and he was sworn in as Special Counsel on March 6, 2024.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: President Biden nominated Hampton Dellinger as Special Counsel on October 3, 2023, with Senate confirmation on February 27, 2024, and swearing-in on March 6, 2024

evidence.text: On February 7, 2025, at 7:22 PM, Special Counsel Dellinger received an email from Sergio Gor, Assistant to the President and the Director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office, which stated in its entirety: 'On behalf of President Donald J. Trump, I am writing to inform you that your position as Special Counsel of the US Office of Special Counsel is terminated, effective immediately. Thank you for your service[.]'
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: On February 7, 2025, at 7:22 PM, Special Counsel Dellinger received a termination email from Sergio Gor stating 'your position as Special Counsel of the US Office of Special Counsel is terminated, effective immediately' with no justification

evidence.text: The one-sentence email does not allege any inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office by Special Counsel Dellinger, nor could it.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The termination email contained no allegations of inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office

evidence.text: Over the preceding three weeks, an unprecedented number of federal employees with civil service protections have been terminated without cause. Senior career officials have been purged from the Federal Bureau of Investigations. Eighteen Inspectors General from across the federal government have been removed without the justification required by statute.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Over three weeks prior, President Trump removed 18 Inspectors General without statutory justification and terminated senior career officials from the FBI

evidence.text: Special Counsel Dellinger's purported termination has sown confusion about his authority to lead the OSC and jeopardized the agency's functioning. Congress authorized the OSC with a crucial investigative and oversight role to protect the integrity of the civil service in circumstances such as these.
evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: The OSC's ability to protect civil service and investigate misconduct is compromised due to the unlawful termination of Special Counsel Dellinger

args.reason: All checklist items (Factual_Basis_of_Case) have been fully extracted with 5 distinct values from the fully visited Complaint document. No further documents need to be processed as the factual basis is comprehensively covered.
